titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Xavier University Alumni Association records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Geoff Edwards

publicationstmt.publisher: Xavier University Archives and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Tim McCabe using the OhioLINK EAD Application in 2014
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Describing Archives: a Content Standard.

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Xavier University Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: This is a collection of various records of the Xavier University Alumni Association and of the Xavier University Alumnae Association. Prior to 1930 Xavier University was known as St. Xavier College. Types of information include administrative materials, alumni listings, and event information.

bioghist.head: History of Xavier University Alumni Association
bioghist.p: The St. Xavier College (later Xavier University) Alumni Association was formed in 1888. The Alumnae Association began in 1926 and merged with the Alumni Association in 1973. The purpose of the organization has been to financially support the university through fund raising and organizational events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of administrative records, alumni listings, events and activities information, and other information.

arrangement.head: Statement of Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into series:

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted access. Please contact the Xavier University archives staff.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Box Number, Folder Number, XUA-38, Alumni Association records, Special Collections and University Archives, Xavier University Library, Cincinnati, Ohio.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Xavier University (Cincinnati, Ohio)--Alumni and alumnae
Xavier University (Cincinnati, Ohio)--Alumni and alumnae--Societies, etc.

Papers and correspondence relating to the Chicago alumni association chapter.
Papers and correspondence relating to the Louisville alumni association chapter, including the constitution and annual reports.

Results of an alumni survey in preparation for launch of University Advancement Fund.
Papers and correspondence relating to various fundraising efforts.
Letters and memoranda to and from the Alumni Association covering various topics, including the need for a school song.

"Alumni Listing": a series of directories listing names alphabetically with address: Directory No. 2 Alumni Association; Directory No.4 Postgraduate and Lyceum & Varia; Directory No. 5 Patrons and Friends of College.
"Alumni Listing"; unbound notebook listing names alphabetically with address and reference number.
Listings of Doctors of Medicine in the Alumni Association
Listings of alumni with Doctorate Degrees (current to c.1983).
Listings of clergy who attended Xavier.

Listings of prominent Xavier graduates, including leaders in law, medicine, architecture, education and business (1971); alumni in the U.S. Congress (1990); biographies of sales executive John B. Naughton (undated (1971?) and journalist Junius Henri Brown (Undated [1930?]; newspaper clippings concerning alumni Dr. Thomas P. Hart, Rev. Theodore H. Rolfes, J. Donald Barman, Joseph Link Jr., and Bishop Harold W. Henry (undated, 1937-1960); World World Two veteran Tom Broderick, as a chapter in the book The Greatest Generation by Tom Brokaw.
Listings of class agents and representatives

Miscellaneous listings of uncertain purpose (undated); plus graduates interested in teaching (1930); alumni on faculty (undated); alumni in the Columbus and Cleveland areas (1953); members of the Ohio College Association (undated).
Papers and correspondence relating to the 75th Anniversary celebrations of the founding of the Alumni Association.
Event programs for the Alumni Association 75th Anniversary celebrations.
Programs and other publicity material for annual Homecoming events.
Programs and other publicity material for the reunion of the class of 1929
50th Anniversary Testimonial certificate presented to the class of 1904 on the occasion of the Testimonial Breakfast, June 5, 1954.
Programs and other publicity material for class specific reunions: Class of 1930

Programs and other publicity material for class specific reunions: Class of 1942
Publicity materials of general alumni reunions.
Invitations, menus, correspondence and other materials, including some guest lists, for the alumni annual dinner.
Copies (x2) of report from "The Cincinnati Commercial Gazette" (May 2, 1889) on the first banquet of the Xavier Alumni Association.
Newspaper article concerning the 1890 "Jubilee Week" celebration, including the Alumni Mass and Banquet, from the "Xavier University News--Centennial Supplement" (25 Sep 1940)
Notifications and correspondence relating to the annual reception for the graduating class.
Papers and correspondence relating to the Communion Breakfast held on March 23, 1941
Correspondence, programs and papers relating to the annual Universal Communion Sunday events.
Notifications sent to alumni, relating to the quarterly meetings of the Association and other events staged.
Correspondence, notes and invitations relating to the Alumni Association's annual lecture series.
Papers, correspondence and publicity material for the lecture held in December 1933 by the Alumni Association featuring Father Bernard J. Hubbard, "The Glacier Priest."
Publicity material and newspaper clippings relating to Father Bernard J. Hubbard, "The Glacier Priest."
Papers relating to the Alumni Association's benefit staged to help Jesuit colleges in California damaged by the 1906 earthquake.
Lists of attendees and other papers relating to the Alumni Luncheon Club.
Correspondence, publicity material and financial records relating to the Alumni production of "the First Legion."
Papers relating to the Dad's Club of Xavier University, including regulations, lists of directors, and material relating to the annual conferences of the club.
Lists of alumni attending retreats
Programs and publicity material for Family Day.
Brochures about the Parents Club and its activities and the 1978 Octoberfest event.
Papers and correspondence relating to Washington's Birthday celebrations staged by the Alumni Association.

Papers and correspondence relating to events staged by the Alumni Association, including "Shakespearean Scenes" (1891), "Columbian Banquet" (1892), and a reception dedicated to Archbishop W. H. Wheeler (1896).
Papers and correspondence relating to miscellaneous social, sporting and educational events.
Programs and publicity material for miscellaneous events staged by local chapters of the Alumni Association.

Papers, correspondence and programs for the annual conference for leaders of local chapters of the Alumni Association. Typically, the conference program lists members of the Association Board of governors and local chapter officers, as well as providing information on the association at a national and local level, such as financial details, results of fund-raising efforts, etc. Also usually provides information about the Xavier campus, such as a map, and information on new development.
Copies of booklets (x2) produced to send to individual alumni and chapter presidents assisting with the recruitment of new students.
Photographs of the Class of 1914; photograph of the Class of 1903, plus a sheet music cover of a song, " Dark Doin's, dedicated to the class.

Notes for a speech by Father Nieporte (undated); "novelty" certificate awarded to Francis A. Gauche (1909); extract from "The Cincinnati Enquirer" reporting a service hald to honor Xavier's war dead (3 Jun 1946)
Mainly papers, correspondence and publicity materials relating to the National Catholic Alumni Federation and the Alumni Association's involvement.
Papers, correspondence and publicity materials relating to the NCAF and Alumni Association's involvement.

Jesuit Alumni Association booklet (x2), including the constitution and a brief history of the Association (1902); "Constitution and By-laws of the Federation of Alumni Associations of Jesuit Colleges in the United States" (undated); program for the "Silver Jubilee and Federation Exercises"of the Federation of Alumni Associations of Jesuit Colleges in the United States (1906); papers relating to the Jesuit Educational Association (1955-1956).
Copies of the Association constitution and by-laws, plus correspondence and drafts relating to revisions. Also, leaflets outlining the structure and function of the Association.
Lists of officers of the Alumnae Association.
Minutes and papers relating to meetings of the Alumnae Association Board of Governors.
Copies of requisition forms for supplies, catering, printing, etc.
Publicity material, honor rolls, correspondence and financial reports relating to the annual Living Endowment Fund appeal.
Miscellaneous correspondence concerning the Alumnae Association, much of it received by Father William A. Dowd.
Lists of members of the Association, plus a small ledger containing a record of dues paid.
Issues of Alumnae Notes for various years.
Newsletters, correspondence, invitations, flyers, reports, newspaper clippings and other papers relating to events and activities staged by the Alumnae Association.

did.unittitle: Alumnae: International Federation of Catholic Alumnae

scopecontent.p: Information relating to the IFCA, including an outline of its history, purpose and organization (1962), copies of the IFCA Bulletin (Mar 1963, Sept 1969), and a directory of members (1961-1964).
A volume of receipts for goods and services.
Minutes and papers of the committees of the Alumni Association, including the Board of Governors.
Class of 1970 proclamation from the Mayor of Cincinnati's office, J. Kenneth Blackwell (1970 alum), declaring October 24 and 25, 1980 to be Xavier Class of 1970 Homecoming Days.
